00031 #ifndef _CONTEXT_H_
00032 #define _CONTEXT_H_
00033 
00034 #include <krb5.h>
00035 
00036 /* Hopefully big enough to hold any serialized context */
00037 #define MAX_CTX_LEN 4096
00038 
00039 /* New context format flag values */
00040 #define KRB5_CTX_FLAG_INITIATOR         0x00000001
00041 #define KRB5_CTX_FLAG_CFX               0x00000002
00042 #define KRB5_CTX_FLAG_ACCEPTOR_SUBKEY   0x00000004
00043 
00044 #if HAVE_KRB5INT_DERIVE_KEY
00045 /* Taken from crypto_int.h */
00046 enum deriv_alg {
00047         DERIVE_RFC3961,         /* RFC 3961 section 5.1 */
00048 #ifdef CAMELLIA
00049         DERIVE_SP800_108_CMAC,  /* NIST SP 800-108 with CMAC as PRF */
00050 #endif
00051 };
00052 
00053 extern krb5_error_code krb5int_derive_key(const void *enc,
00054                                           krb5_key inkey, krb5_key *outkey,
00055                                           const krb5_data *in_constant,
00056                                           enum deriv_alg alg);
00057 extern krb5_error_code krb5_k_create_key(krb5_context context,
00058                                          const krb5_keyblock *key_data,
00059                                          krb5_key *out);
00060 #else /* !HAVE_KRB5INT_DERIVE_KEY */
00061 
00062 extern krb5_error_code krb5_derive_key(const void *enc,
00063                                        const krb5_keyblock *inkey,
00064                                        krb5_keyblock *outkey,
00065                                        const krb5_data *in_constant);
00066 #endif
00067 
00068 int serialize_context_for_kernel(gss_ctx_id_t ctx, gss_buffer_desc *buf,
00069                                  gss_OID mech);
00070 int serialize_spkm3_ctx(gss_ctx_id_t ctx, gss_buffer_desc *buf);
00071 int serialize_krb5_ctx(gss_ctx_id_t ctx, gss_buffer_desc *buf);
00072 
00073 #endif /* _CONTEXT_H_ */
